attributes.action: Place speeding measures outside Asterdale Primary School, Spondon
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of the school are wanting speed measures in place outside the school to make drivers aware of children crossing. 
There are no zebra crossings, no speed signs, nothing. It is very dangerous for children who are on the way home or to school. 
We need help to get support for something to be done before another child gets seriously hurt. Next time they may not be as lucky.
attributes.background:
The school is on the slip road from the a52 towards Derby. 
During school drop off and collection times 8.45-9.00am. And 3.15-3.30pm. The road can be a very dangerous place due to parked cars. 
There are no speed measures in place to slow cars down coming off the A52.

rejection.details:
We understand you are very concerned about the safety of children outside Asterdale Primary School, Spondon, but we can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This appears to be the responsibility of the responsibility of Derby City Council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.derby.gov.uk/council-and-democracy/consultations/petitions/
